en.mm_tip: Click on the Moon or the Constellation to choose a Game Mode!
en.Desc_NewMoon: When the Moon moves between Earth and the Sun, the side facing Earth is completely dark. Only the side of the Moon facing away from Earth is lit.
en.Desc_WaxingCrescentMoon: After the new moon phase, the moon begins to be seen again. Gradually it starts to appear as part of its surface that is illuminated can be seen.
en.Desc_FirstQuarterMoon: Like always, one side of the Moon is completely lit by the Sun. What has changed is the Moon's position with respect to Earth. We are only able to see half of that half lit portion.
en.Desc_WaxingGibbousMoon: Is an intermediate Moon phase which starts after the First Quarter Moon and lasts until the Full Moon.
en.Desc_FullMoon: The whole side facing Earth is lit. This happens when Earth is between the Moon and the Sun.
en.Desc_WanningGibbousMoon: Is an intermediate Moon phase which starts after a Full Moon and lasts until half of the Moon's surface is illuminated at Third Quarter Moon.
en.Desc_ThirdQuarterMoon: Is when the opposite half of the Moon is illuminated compared to the First Quarter.
en.Desc_WanningCrescentMoon: The illuminated part of the Moon decreases from a semicircle at Third Quarter moon phase until it disappears from view entirely at New Moon.
en.desc_constellations: Guide your ship in the direction of the constellation!
en.info_desc_constellations: A constellation is a group of visible stars that form a pattern when viewed from Earth. The pattern they form may take the shape of an animal, a mythological creature, a man, a woman, or an inanimate object such as a microscope, a compass, or a crown.
en.desc_moon: Advance in the days until you recognize the indicated moon phase.
en.info_desc_moon: Unlike the Sun, the Moon does not produce any light of its own. It only reflects light from the Sun. Only the side of the Moon facing the Sun is lit. As the Moon moves around the Earth, we see different parts of the Moon being lit up by the Sun. This is what causes the phases of the Moon. As the Moon revolves around Earth, it changes from fully lit to completely dark and back again.
en.tuto_moon_a: Advance in the days until you recognize the indicated moon phase.
en.tuto_moon_c: Click here for more information about moon phases.
en.tuto_consts_a: The constellations were used for navigation in ancient times.
en.tuto_consts_b: Guide your ship in the direction of the constellation.
en.tuto_consts_c: Activate the green lever to reach the goal!
en.speak_info_menu_moon: Moon Phases. Unlike the Sun, the Moon does not produce any light of its own. It only reflects light from the Sun. Only the side of the Moon facing the Sun is lit. As the Moon moves around the Earth, we see different parts of the Moon being lit up by the Sun. This is what causes the phases of the Moon. As the Moon revolves around Earth, it changes from fully lit to completely dark and back again.
en.speak_info_menu_cons: NAVIGATION WITH CONSTELLATIONS. A constellation is a group of visible stars that form a pattern when viewed from Earth. The pattern they form may take the shape of an animal, a mythological creature, a man, a woman, or an inanimate object such as a microscope, a compass, or a crown.
en.speak_moon_info_1: New Moon. When the Moon moves between Earth and the Sun, the side facing Earth is completely dark. Only the side of the Moon facing away from Earth is lit.
en.speak_moon_info_2: Waxing Crescent Moon. After the new moon phase, the moon begins to be seen again. Gradually it starts to appear as part of its surface that is illuminated can be seen.
en.speak_moon_info_3: First Quarter Moon. Like always, one side of the Moon is completely lit by the Sun. What has changed is the Moon's position with respect to Earth. We are only able to see half of that half lit portion.
en.speak_moon_info_4: Waxing Gibbous Moon. Is an intermediate Moon phase which starts after the First Quarter Moon and lasts until the Full Moon.
en.speak_moon_info_5: Full Moon. The whole side facing Earth is lit. This happens when Earth is between the Moon and the Sun.
en.speak_moon_info_6: Wanning Gibbous Moon. Is an intermediate Moon phase which starts after a Full Moon and lasts until half of the Moon's surface is illuminated at Third Quarter Moon.
en.speak_moon_info_7: Third Quarter Moon. Is when the opposite half of the Moon is illuminated compared to the First Quarter.
en.speak_moon_info_8: Wanning Crescent Moon. The illuminated part of the Moon decreases from a semicircle at Third Quarter moon phase until it disappears from view entirely at New Moon.
